titles.title: Export Administration Modification and Clarification Act of 2000
Export Administration Modification and Clarification Act of 2000
To provide for increased penalties for violations of the Export Administration Act of 1979, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Committee Agreed to Seek Consideration Under Suspension of the Rules, by Voice Vote.

action.text: Mr. Gilman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5239.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.
Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Bereuter moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on the motion.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: 10/11/2000--Passed Senate amended. Amends the Export Administration Act of 1979 to extend its export control authority through August 20, 2001.
